docs.text: The Title and Description are shown without any container.

docs.title: Title Font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Title.

docs.title: Description font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Description.

docs.title: Modules Theme
docs.text:
Modules theme customisation can be accessed from the "settings" screen. Customisation involves the graphic appearance of:

  • Favourites pop-ups
  • Search pop-up
  • Loading pop-up
  • Comments pop-up

To edit the Comments pop-up, select the Comment theme and edit it.

docs.title: Outer margin colour
docs.text: Sets the Pop-up container margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness
docs.text: Sets the Pop-up container margin thickness.

docs.title: Background colour
docs.text: Sets the Pop-up background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the Pop-up should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low
  • Medium
  • High

docs.title: Button/control colour
docs.text: Sets the colour that any buttons/controls inside the Pop-up should have.

docs.title: Button font
docs.text: Sets the font inside buttons.

docs.title: Content font
docs.text: Sets the font in any content (i.e. comments).

docs.title: Navigation bar theme
docs.text: The navigation bar can also be customised for each individual section, setting the following options:

docs.title: Navigation Type
docs.text:
Sets the type of bar in 2 different modes:

  • Bar complete with navigation and function button: the navigation bar will be complete with "Breadcrumbs" navigation and function buttons.
  • Function buttons only: only function buttons will be shown.

docs.title: Bar position
docs.text:
• Top: the bar will be positioned at the top of the screen.
  • Bottom: the bar will be positioned at the bottom of the screen.

docs.title: Closing [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text:
• Always visible: the navigation bar always stays visible.
  • Allow closing: a button to show or hide the navigation bar will be shown.

docs.title: Outer margin colour [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text: Sets the navigation bar container margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text: Sets the navigation bar container margin thickness.

docs.title: Background colour [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text: Sets the navigation bar background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the navigation bar should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low

  • High

docs.title: Folder/button colour [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text: Sets the colour of folders and function buttons.

docs.title: Folder font [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text: Sets folder font.

docs.title: Current folder font [Only in complete bar mode]
docs.text: Sets current folder font.

docs.title: Button type [Only in button function only mode]
docs.text:
• Standard: the buttons displayed will be those standard loaded during installation.
  • Custom: Custom buttons can be loaded. Buttons must have already been loaded in their desired colour.

docs.title: Button colour [Only in standard button function only mode]
docs.text: Sets the colour of standard buttons.

docs.title: Preview Bar Theme
docs.text: The preview bar can also be customised for each individual section, setting the following options:

docs.title: Bar position
docs.text:
Sets the position of the bar on he screen. You can choose from:

  • Right
  • Bottom
  • Left

docs.title: Outer margin
docs.text: Sets the outer margin that the preview bar should have on the screen.

docs.title: Preview size
docs.text: Sets the side of thumbnails.

docs.title: Preview margin
docs.text: Sets the margin of each thumbnail with respect to the container and to other thumbnails.

docs.title: Scrollbar
docs.text:
• Show: shows the bar to scroll thumbnails if they exit the visual area.
  • Hide: no bar is shown

docs.title: Open the first element
docs.text: The first preview bar element is opened automatically.

docs.title: In the foreground
docs.text: The preview bar stays over contents on the screen.

docs.title: Outer margin colour
docs.text: Sets the preview bar container margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness
docs.text: Sets the preview bar container margin thickness.

docs.title: Corner rounding
docs.text: Sets the preview bar container corner rounding. Expressed in pixels in this order: Top-Left, Top-Right, Bottom-right, Bottom-Left.

docs.title: Bar background colour
docs.text: Sets the preview bar background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the preview bar should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low
  • Medium
  • High

docs.title: Title /control colour
docs.text: Sets the colour of the title, icon and thumbnail margin.

docs.title: Label
docs.text:
Shows the label over each thumbnail. You can choose from:

  • None: no label is shown.
  • Title: the content title is shown.
  • File name: the name of the file is shown.

docs.title: Font
docs.text: Sets the label font if Title or File Name are chosen.

docs.title: Tool Pop-up Theme
docs.text: The Tool pop-up contains buttons for activating tools on displayed content. They are visible when the size of content exceeds monitor resolution size. Also set pop-up colour�from the [Draw-On] feature (/en/2.17/media-manager/features/draw-on.md).

docs.title: Outer margin colour
docs.text: Sets the pop-up margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness
docs.text: Sets the pop-up margin thickness.

docs.title: Pop-up background colour
docs.text: Sets the pop-up background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the pop-up should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low
  • Medium
  • High

docs.title: Button/control colour
docs.text: Sets the colour of buttons on the toolbar and on any content controls

docs.title: Button font
docs.text: Sets the font style inside buttons.

docs.title: Title font
docs.text: Sets the font style of the content title.

docs.title: Description font
docs.text: Sets the font style of the content description.

docs.title: Viewer theme
docs.text: The viewer is the element that houses loaded content within it. You can graphically customise each individual viewer, even inside the same section, by setting the following options with the theme manager:

docs.title: Outer margin colour
docs.text: Sets the container margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness
docs.text: Sets the container margin thickness.

docs.title: Element background colour
docs.text: Sets the container background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the container should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low
  • Medium
  • High

docs.title: Toolbars
docs.text:
Lets you manage bar visibility:

  • Always visible: the toolbar always stays visible.
  • Hide automatically: the toolbar hides automatically after a few seconds of content inactivity-

docs.title: Button/control colour
docs.text: Sets the colour of buttons on the toolbar and on any content controls

docs.title: Title/button/control colour
docs.text: Sets the toolbar background colour.

docs.title: Title font
docs.text: Sets the font style of the content title.

docs.title: Description font
docs.text: Sets the font style of the content description.

docs.title: Description background colour
docs.text: Sets the colour of the background on which the description appears.

docs.title: Open the software
docs.text: You can click on the icon on the desktop to boot Touchviewer®. At the first boot the following window will be shown.

docs.title: Activating the license
docs.text: Enter the license key and click on Activate button for activating the software.  If the license is valid the software will automatically start.  Press F12 on the keyboard to go to Media Manager.  ### Entering credentials If during installation you chose to protect the Media Manager with authentication, you will be asked to set a USERNAME and a PASSWORD, which will be required each time you want to access the Media Manager.  ![](/img/first-boot_2.png)  !!! notes     The device must be connected to the internet to activate the license.     You will not be able to deactivate the license once it has been activated on the device.     Contact assistance to deactivate the license.

docs.title: INSTALLATION
docs.text:
1. Remove content from the .zip archive containing the software

  2. Click on setup.exe

  3. Select the default language and press OK

  4. Select whether you want to protect access to the Media Manager with Username and Password entry (from version 2.13)

  5. Accept the license agreement and press FORWARD

  6. Select the installation folder and press FORWARD

  7. Select the installation folder and press INSTALL

  8. Install the Video Codec by pressing YES

  9. Select Normal mode and press NEXT to start

  10. In case a version of K-Lite has already been installed press NEXT and go to point 19

  11. Select Install only 64 bit component and click on NEXT

  12. Click on NEXT

  13. Click on NEXT

  14. Click on NEXT

  15. Click on NEXT

  16. Click on DECLINE

  17. Click on INSTALL

  18. Click on FINISH

  19. Click on END

docs.title: What is Touchviewer?
docs.text:
Touchviewer is an application for creating and managing your multimedia content. It is the ideal support for real-life Multi-Touch experiences for your users, in malls, museums, sales outlets, and trade fairs.

Touchviewer helps your customers find information about your products, and helps your visitors discover, learn and explore in museums. Touchviewer lets you manage and update your content independently and without writing a single line of code. Simplicity and intuition are the winning combination.

docs.title: Create your presentations
docs.text: Touchviewer has been designed and built for use via touch display, allowing users simple, intuitive navigation. With a quick gesture, you can zoom in on very high resolution images, see videos, navigate the internet, view interactive maps with points of interest, write, read and draw. The answer to your gestures is fluid, realistic, fast and natural.

docs.title: For all touch devices
docs.text: Touchviewer is the only software that allows you to automatically adapt the work screen to any display and to any resolution, from 4K monitors to infinite Touch Wall display compositions. Touchviewer can also be configured in a Multi-User version. The work area can be divided or multiple navigation menus can be activated on the screen in order to manage and share content with multiple users at the same time.

docs.title: Hardware
docs.text:
Minimum Requirements CPU: Intel Core i5 (6th Gen) Graphics card: Intel HD Graphics 530, GTX 1030 / Ati 2GB Ram: 8GB

Recommended Requirements CPU: Intel Core i5 (7th Gen) Storage: SSD 256GB Graphics card: Intel HD Graphics 630, GTX 1050ti / Ati 4GB Ram: 16GB

Server’s Requirements (ENTERPRISE) CPU: Intel Core i5 (7th Gen) Storage: SSD 256GB Graphics card: Intel HD Graphics 630, GTX 1050ti / Ati 4GB Ram: 16GB network card: 1000 Mbit/s

docs.text:
Operating System Windows 10 Anniversary Edition

Libraries Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 (Automatically installed as prerequisite) K-lite Standard edition (Automatically installed as prerequisite) VLC (For enabling streaming video function - Download VLC)

docs.text:
• Update to Chronium’s version 65 of the internal browser
  • More map types available: Google Maps, ArcGIS, OpenStreetMap and Bing.
  • Sharing favorite content
  • New Snapshot function for creating snapshots of web pages, images and documents

docs.title: Archive Folder
docs.text: Here you can see which archive you are currently pointing to. Click on this icon to change the archive, pointing to another folder. Click on this icon to refresh archive contents and folders Click on this icon to open the folder in the Windows Explorer.

docs.title: Folder
docs.text: The folder and file structure of the archive you are pointing to is shown. You can also edit the archive by adding or removing the folders and files in it. Right-click on the folders or contents to open a sub-menu from where you can perform different operations as described below.

docs.title: Folder sub-menu
docs.text:
1. Update the folder
  2. Open the folder in Windows Explorer
  3. Delete the folder and its contents
  4. Access folder Options. Go to the section Folder Options
  5. Add content to the folder. Go to the section Add Contents
  6. Create a sub-folder
  7. Hide the current folder and it will not be shown in the Media Presenter
  8. This folder can be linked to another. Click on this section to view the contents of the linked folder in the Media Presenter.

docs.title: File sub-menu
docs.text:
1. Open the file with the default Windows program assigned for that type of file
  2. Delete the file from the folder
  3. Access File Options Go to the section Content Options
  4. The file will be duplicated

docs.title: Content Options
docs.text:
These options can be accessed in 2 ways:

  • By right-clicking on the content you want in the content tree view.
  • By right-clicking directly on the element in the Media Presenter preview.

docs.title: Title
docs.text: The name displayed in the Media Presenter.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The description displayed in the Media Presenter after you click on the icon

docs.title: Position
docs.text: The order in which an element is displayed on the screen or in the preview bar.

docs.title: Minimum and maximum file size
docs.text: Sets the minimum and maximum size in which content can be resized. The values set in content properties are inherited as default. Go to content properties.

docs.title: Viewer theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the container that embeds the displayed file. The theme set in content properties is inherited as default. Go to Viewer theme.

docs.title: Tool pop-up theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the toolbar that appears when content is bigger than the software window. The theme set in content properties is inherited as default. Go to Tool pop-up theme.

docs.title: Dragging
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to move content on the screen. The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to content properties.

docs.title: Rotation
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to rotate content on the screen. The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to content properties.

docs.title: Zoom
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to zoom content on the screen. The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to content properties.

docs.title: External opening
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to externally open content with the default program for that type of file. The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to content properties.

docs.title: Bottom bar
docs.text: Enables or disables the bottom bar for interacting with that type of content. (Ex.: the Player video is hidden in a video content).

docs.title: Display method if starting on the screen
docs.text:
Option to decide whether to immediately show Content or its Preview. If you choose Preview, a replacement image will be loaded in the _Preview_tabs.

Go to Preview.

docs.title: Full screen
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to open content in full screen mode via the icon in the content toolbar. The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to content properties.

docs.title: Full screen mode
docs.text:
Sets the mode in which content should open in full screen. There are 3 different modes to choose from:

  • On Request: Content is opened by clicking on the icon
  • Always: Content can only be viewed in full screen mode
  • At start-up: Content appears in full screen mode when it is dragged onto the screen.

docs.title: Full screen closing
docs.text: Removes the possibility of exiting from full screen mode.

docs.title: Editing
docs.text: Enables Draw-on feature on that content by clicking on the icon The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to Draw-On feature.

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: Enables the comment entry feature on that content by clicking on the icon The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default. Go to Comments features.

docs.title: Printing
docs.text: Enables the printing feature on that content by clicking on the icon The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default.

docs.title: Favourites
docs.text: Enables the possibility of entering content among favourites by clicking on the icon The setting entered in content properties is inherited as default.

docs.title: Activate button for following process start
docs.text: A process can be executed by entering the path on the filesystem of the process to be executed. The process can be launched by clicking on the icon

docs.title: Audio
docs.text: Associates an audio file to content with the option of starting the audio when content is opened by means of the corresponding checkmark. Audio can be stopped or re-started by pressing the icon More than one audio file can be played at the same time.

docs.title: Preview
docs.text: Content can be viewed as a preview if in the Display method settings: start on screen is set to Preview. The appearance and position of the preview is set in these configurations.

docs.title: Custom image
docs.text: Insertion of the image to be used as a preview of content.

docs.title: Rotation
docs.text: The preview is rotated in the clockwise direction to the degrees entered in this field.

docs.title: ZIndex
docs.text: Sorting in the Z axis of elements.

docs.title: Relative position (X,Y)
docs.text: Defines the position on the screen and is relative to the top left corner with coordinates (0,0).

docs.title: File display method (Previews list)
docs.text: Defines the presentation layout of the thumbnails contained in a preview bar.

docs.title: Preview bar theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the preview bar. Go to Preview bar theme.

docs.title: Element margin
docs.text: Defines the distance between the margin of an element and its content (measurement expressed in pixels in the following order Left, Up, Right, Down)

docs.title: Screen divider
docs.text: Activates the screen divider bar for real time comparison of images and documents.

docs.title: Maximum draggable files
docs.text: Sets the number of draggable content on the screen from the preview bar.

docs.title: Positioning on screen
docs.text:
There are 2 possible content positioning modes:

  • _Manual:_content can be placed as desired on the screen by holding down the CTRL key and dragging content to the screens at the desired position.
  • Grid: contents are distributed within a grid. See paragraph below.

docs.title: Grid layout mode
docs.text:
There are different modes for grid display:

  • Automatic: default setting, elements are distributed on multiple rows depending on the space available. Press X to return to this setting.
  • Template: You can choose one of the many templates available in the drop down menu.

docs.title: Element margin
docs.text: Defines the distance between the margin of an element and its content (measurement expressed in pixels in the following order Left, Up, Right, Down)

docs.title: Outside margin
docs.text: Defines the distance between the margin of an element and the margin of the screen (measurement expressed in pixels in the following order Left, Up, Right, Down)

docs.title: Viewer theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the container that embeds the displayed file. Go to Viewer theme.

docs.title: Tool pop-up theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the toolbar that appears when content is bigger than the software window. Go to Tool pop-up theme.

docs.title: Minimum and maximum file size
docs.text: Sets the minimum and maximum size in which content in the folder can be resized.

docs.title: Dragging
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to move contents on the screen.

docs.title: Rotation
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to rotate contents on the screen.

docs.title: Zoom
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to zoom contents on the screen.

docs.title: External opening
docs.text: Enables or disables the option to externally open contents with the default program for that type of file.

docs.title: Full screen
docs.text: Enables the option to open contents in full screen mode via the icon in the contents toolbar.

docs.title: Editing
docs.text: Enables Draw-on feature on that contents by clicking on the icon

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: Enables the comment entry feature on contents by clicking on the icon

docs.title: Printing
docs.text: Enables the printing feature on contents by clicking on the icon

docs.title: Favourites
docs.text: Enables the possibility of entering contents among favourites by clicking on the icon

docs.title: Folder Options
docs.text:
These options can be accessed in 2 ways:

  • By right-clicking on the folder you want in the content tree view.
  • By right-clicking directly on the element in the Media Presenter preview.

docs.title: Name displayed
docs.text: The name displayed in the Media Presenter if in the Elements theme the following is chosen as the element Template: form, image and text, text only.

docs.title: Image
docs.text: The image displayed in the Media Presenter if in the Elements theme the following is chosen as the element Template: image, image and text.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The description displayed in the Media Presenter if in the Elements theme the following is chosen as the element Template: form.

docs.title: Position
docs.text: The order in which the element is displayed in the Media Presenter.

docs.title: Rotation
docs.text: The element is rotated in the clockwise direction to the degrees entered in this field.

docs.title: ZIndex
docs.text: Sorting in the Z axis of elements.

docs.title: Relative position (X,Y)
docs.text: Defines the position relative to the starting position if automatic layout of the elements is set. In the even that it is chosen as Folder display method -> Free for absolute positioning, see here, the position is relative to the top left corner with coordinates (0,0).

docs.title: Elements theme
docs.text: The elements theme set for the parent folder is inherited as default. A new specific theme can be set for this folder only. To set the Theme see Elements theme.

docs.title: Navigation bar theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the navigation bar. Go to Navigation bar theme.

docs.title: Folder Background
docs.text: Lets you insert a background image that replaces the default one.

docs.title: File adaptation
docs.text:
Defines the background adaptation mode with respect to the screen:

  • Stretch: The file is adapted to the resolution of the window without retaining the original proportions [default]
  • None: the file is not adjusted and you can choose where it should appear
  • Adjust Internally: The file is adjusted, keeping its proportions inside the window
  • Adjust Externally: The file is adjusted, keeping its proportions covering the entire visible screen area

docs.title: Folder display method
docs.text:
Defines the distribution of folders on the screen:

  • Grid: Folders are distributed within a grid. Elements are distributed on multiple rows depending on the space available.
  • Vertical list: Folders are distributed vertically; they can be scrolled if there is not enough space on the screen.
  • Horizontal list: Folders are distributed horizontally; they can be scrolled if there is not enough space on the screen.
  • Carousel: Folders are shown in a circular carousel with the possibility of scrolling.
  • Free for absolute positioning: Folders can be placed as desired on the screen by holding down the CTRL key and dragging them to the screens at the desired position.

docs.title: Container background
docs.text: Lets you set a background for the folder container.

docs.title: Container margins
docs.text: Sets the distance between the external margins of the screen and its contained elements (measurement expressed in pixels in the following order Left, Up, Right, Down)

docs.title: Container dimensions
docs.text: Sets the minimum and maximum dimensions of the screen that contains the visual elements (measurements expressed in pixels in the following order Width, Height)

docs.title: Scrollbar
docs.text: Enables display of the scrollbar on the right in the event that elements are larger than the screen

docs.title: Elements theme
docs.text: Defines the graphic appearance of the buttons on the screen. Go to Elements Theme.

docs.title: Element margins
docs.text: Defines the distance between the margin of an element and its content (measurement expressed in pixels in the following order Left, Up, Right, Down)

docs.title: Minimum and maximum element size
docs.text: Sets the minimum and maximum dimensions of the element on the screen (measurements expressed in pixels in the following order Width, Height)

docs.title: Carousel
docs.text:
Select the Folders / Carousel display method to manage the following additional properties:

  • Type of curve: Sets the distribution of elements (half ellipse, ellipse, line, arc, sine wave)
  • Element rotation: Defines the maximum rotation of the element at the farthest point of the curve
  • _Visible elements:_Set the visible elements in the carousel
  • Repeat: Elements are repeated indefinitely

docs.title: Language
docs.text: Choose the Media Manager language from Italian or English.

docs.title: Opening
docs.text: Single Instance: Only one Touchviewer can be opened [default]. Multiple Instances: Multiple Touchviewer windows can be opened.

docs.title: Window style
docs.text: Without margins: The Media Presenter opens in full screen mode [default]. Standard: The Media Presenter opens in�windowed mode.

docs.title: Dimensions
docs.text:
Full screen: The Media Presenter will occupy the entire available screen. Custom: The Media Presenter will open to the size set in additional properties: - Width: Window width: - Height: Window height:

Position: Position where the window should open: - Centre: The window will open at the centre of the screen. - Custom: The window will be able to open in the desired position by setting additional properties: - Left: Position with respect to the left margin. - Top: Position with respect to the top margin.

docs.title: Background
docs.text: Background colour: Uniform colour that the background of the screen will have. Background video or image: Default image to be used as a background. File adaptation: Defines the background adaptation mode with respect to the screen: - Stretch: The file is adapted to the resolution of the window without retaining the original proportions [default] - None: the file is not adjusted and you can choose where it should appear - Adjust Internally: The file is adjusted, keeping its proportions inside the window - Adjust Externally: The file is adjusted, keeping its proportions covering the entire visible screen area

docs.title: Quality
docs.text: Quality: Represents the quality index of the general graphics aspect of the software and the contents loaded in it. Mouse: Shows / hides the mouse cursor. Touch points: Shows / hides the touch cursor. Touch points colour: Indicates the colour in which the touch cursor is viewed. DPI Documents: Defines the quality factor for automatic PDF, DOC, DOCX document conversion. Simultaneous videos: Defines the number of the videos to be played at the same time on the screen.

docs.title: Draw-on
docs.text: Pencil brush colour: Sets the default colour for the draw-on feature. Style: Sets the default style for the draw-on feature. Line size: Sets the default line size for the draw-on feature. Include drawings in printing: Includes drawings in document printing.

docs.title: General settings
docs.text: Bing map key: Specify a registered key for Bing Map provider use. External opening of files: Enables the option to open content with the default windows program. Full screen: Enables the option to open full screen content. Editing: Enables draw-on feature on all content. Print: Enables printing feature on all content. Favourites: Enables the feature of adding favourites on all content. Send e-mail from favourites: Enables the ability to share content via e-mail Enable search: Enables the search feature in the archive. Enable magnetic rotation: When enabled, content can be rotated at 90� steps. Multiple info point opening:__When enabled, you can open more than one information point at a time. __Modules theme: Graphics customisation of "Favourites", "Search", etc. modules Go to Modules theme

docs.title: Email settings
docs.text:
• Default sender: Default e-mail address for sending e-mails.
  • Smtp Hosting: Specify the SMTP protocol for content sharing via e-mail.
  • Username: Specify the account Username for content sharing via e-mail.
  • Password: Specify the account Password for content sharing via e-mail.
  • Port: Specify the SMTP protocol port for content sharing via e-mail.
  • Ssl: Specify whether the smtp account requires active SSL.

docs.title: Screensaver Settings
docs.text: Type: Enables the screensaver by image and video sequences. Activation: Value in seconds which determines screensaver activation in case of user inactivity. Photo time: Value in seconds that determines the pause of photos in sequence. Videos and/or images: Selection of files to import into the screensaver. File adaptation: Defines the file adaptation mode with respect to the screen: - Stretch: The file is adapted to the resolution of the window without retaining the original proportions [default] - None: the file is not adjusted and you can choose where it should appear - Adjust Internally: The file is adjusted, keeping its proportions inside the window - Adjust Externally: The file is adjusted, keeping its proportions covering the entire visible screen area It is also possible to alternate between photos and videos within the same screensaver.

docs.title: Snapshot Settings
docs.text: Enable Snapshot: Enable Snapshot function for creating content’s snapshots Copy, editing and comments: the snapshot includes also any notes or comments Delete at closing: the snapshot is deleted at closing

docs.title: Zooming User Interface Settings
docs.text: Enable Zooming User Interface: Enable Zooming User Interface function Traslation: Coordinates of the initial point where the center of infinite stage is positioned Scale: Initial scale of infinite stage Reset: Reset to traslation and scale’s default values

docs.title: Floating Menu Settings
docs.text:
Enable Floating Menu: Enable Floating Menu function Menu’s Background Colour: Set up menu’s colour Icon/folder’s colour: Set up the background colour of each folder’s icon. Character: Set up Font style in file and folders’ titles Change Start Icon: Enable the possibility of changing Start Icon that opens the menu Background Colour of Start Icon: Set up the background colour of Start Icon that opens the menu Number of initial Menus: Set up the number of initial menus that can be opened Menu Rotation: Enable the possibility to rotate the menu Enable Circle Gesture: Enable Circle gesture for opening the floating menu Gesture’s Colour: Set up the colour of Circle gesture’s trace Direct the new menus according to the edge of the stage: the new menus created through the circle gesture are directed according to the corresponding edge of the stage Open new menus with folders’ view: the newly created menu is already open Maximum number of new Menus: Set up the maximum number of new menus that can be opened Delete new Menus once closed: the newly created menus, once the are closed, are deleted from the stage and it will be necessary to create new ones

HOME FILE’S VISUALIZATION In the Menu: the files inside archive’s root are visualized inside the menu On the stage: the files inside archive’s root are visualized on the stage

docs.title: Toolbox Menu Settings
docs.text:
Enable Toolbox: Enable the toolbox with all the useful tools for navigation Toolbox button’s background: Setup the background colour of the button that opens the toolbox Change Toolbox Icon: Change the icon of the button that opens the toolbox Open expanded Toolbox: the toolbox is automatically shown as opened Enable Drag: the toolbox can be moved to the stage Reset at folder change: when you change the folder during navigation the toolbox is automatically moved to the initial place

ENABLE BUTTONS Research: enable the button for opening the research function Home: enable the button for coming back to Home page External Content: enable the button for opening the interface that allows the import of external content Back: Enable the button for coming back to the previous folder Close: Enable the button for closing Touchviewer Lock/Unlock Zooming User Interface: enable the button for locking/unlocking the drag and zoom functions of Zooming user interface

docs.title: External Content Settings
docs.text: Enable external content: enable the possibility of opening external content Open the window to a USB device connection: when a USB device is connected to the PC the interface for external content’s import automatically opens Possibility to save new content: when external new content is closed the system asks if you want to save it

docs.title: Wishlist Settings
docs.text: Enable Multiuser Favorites: Enable Favorites function Popup width: set up the width of the window that shows favorite content Popup height: set up the height of the window that shows favorite content

docs.title: Web Browser Settings
docs.text:
• You can enable or disable the Bookmarks function
  • You can enable the automatic input of log-in credentials for a direct access to protected area
  • Manually input for URLs and labels to display (and if required the related log-in credentials)
  • Enable or disable a Bookmarks already entered

docs.title: Networking Settings
docs.text: Enable Multiuser Favorites: Enable Favorites function Popup width: set up the width of the window that shows favorite content Popup height: set up the height of the window that shows favorite content

docs.title: WORKSPACE
docs.text:
The Media Manager interface is extremely simple and intuitive and contains all the tools for customising the Touchviewer� application.

  1. Secondary menus

  2. Tabs for accessing the Contents / Settings / Synchronisation sections

  3. Area for archive selection and folder and content entry

  4. Folder and content properties panel

  5. Real time preview

docs.title: External Application
docs.text: This function allows the use of an external application inside Touchviewer.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set:

  • Path: path of the executable file to be launched .

  • The size of the window where the video should be viewed.

  • Path: path of the executable file to be launched

  • Arguments: optional parameters to be passed via the command line when starting the application.

docs.title: Image List
docs.text: When entering Image List type content, in addition to the file list, you must enter the name that this collection of images must have in order to identify it in the archive. You can also insert large format images in the following formats: jpg, png, gif, bmp, tiff.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set the type of image list display:

  • Book with button navigation.
  • Book with thumbnail navigation.
  • Book without navigation.
  • Image list with thumbnail navigation.

You can also enter information points in contents of the type Image List. See Info Points

docs.title: Images
docs.text:
You can also insert large format images in the following formats: jpg, png, gif, bmp, tiff. Images must be in RGB format.

Additionally, you can insert information points inside image type contents. See Info Points

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
To add content, right-click on the folder you want and select the "Add Content to Folder" option.

A dialogue window will be displayed, from where you can select the type of content and files from a specific computer folder.

docs.title: Types of content
docs.text:
Content is automatically converted to the format compatible with the software. During conversion, an indicator will be displayed to show the progress of that process.

Content type options:

  • Single files: Allows you to select files (images, videos, and documents) that will be displayed individually.
  • Link file from other folders: Allows you to attach a file that is inside another folder in the same archive.
  • Image list: Allows you to select files (images only) that will be shown on a special display inside the screen
  • Video list: Allows you to select files (images only) that will be shown on a special display inside the screen
  • Web browser: Allows you to insert a web browser for internet navigation
  • Interactive map: Allows you to insert a map to display paths and information points
  • Video input: Allows you to view a video taken from a webcam or camera connected to your PC.
  • Video streaming: Allows you to view video streaming by entering the MRL (media resource locator path).
  • External application: allows you to use an external application inside Touchviewer®.

docs.title: Operations on content
docs.text:
Right-click on entered content to perform the following operations:

  • Open: Allows you to open content with the default windows program for that file type.
  • Delete: Allows you to delete content from the archive (caution: will delete the file permanently).
  • Options: Allows access to options for that file type. See Content Options
  • Duplicate: Allows you to duplicate that file within the archive.

docs.title: PDF and Documents
docs.text:
Documents can be entered in the following formats: PDF, doc, docx, ppt, pptx, xls, xlsx. Please note that the Microsft Office package installed on your computer for docs, ppts, and xls to be converted with Touchviewer.

Images contained in the documents must be in RGB format. Save and convert documents in RGB.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set the type of image list display:

  • Book with button navigation.
  • Book with thumbnail navigation.
  • Book without navigation.
  • Image list with thumbnail navigation.

You can also enter information points in contents of the type Image List. See Info Points

docs.title: Video Input
docs.text: When entering Video Input content, enter the name that you want to identify it with in the archive.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set:

  • The video device that is connected to the PC.
  • The size of the window where the video should be viewed.

docs.title: Video List
docs.text: When entering Video List type content, in addition to the file list, you must enter the name that this collection of videos must have in order to identify it in the archive. Videos can be entered in the following formats: wmv, flv, 3gp, mov, mp4, mpg, avi.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set:

  • The size in which the selected video is played.
  • Whether to start the first video automatically when you open the Video List.
  • Whether to switch to the next video automatically at the end of the video you are playing.

docs.title: Video Streaming
docs.text: When entering Video Streaming content, enter the name that you want to identify it with in the archive.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set:

  • The MRL (media resource locator path) is the path of the stream source.
  • Options, optional parameters to pass through the MRL.
  • The size of the window where the video should be viewed.

docs.title: Videos
docs.text: Videos can be entered in the following formats: wmv, flv, 3gp, mov, mp4, mpg, avi.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set the following behaviours:

  • Start the video automatically upon opening.
  • Repeat the video at the end of play (loop).
  • Close the video at the end of play.
  • Set the background colour of the video when loading.

docs.title: Web Browser
docs.text: When entering Web Browser content, enter the name that you want to identify it with in the archive.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
You can set:

  • URL of the starting page.
  • Size of the browser window.
  • Filter of domain names that can be navigated.
  • Enable navigation, lets you exit the current page via links.
  • You can edit the URL in the address bar.
  • View the navigation bar.

docs.title: Bookmarks
docs.text:
With the new Bookmarks feature you can setting a list of favorite websites to browse and save the log-in credentials and passwords for a direct and secure access.

By clicking on the icon you can access to the list of saved Bookmarks.

By clicking on the icon you can add or remove an URL from the saved Bookmark's list.

You can enable and manage the Bookmarks feature from the Media Manager settings Go to Web Browser Settings

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: This tool lets you make text annotations on elements on the screen by clicking on the button on the content tool bar.

docs.title: Draw-on
docs.text:
With this tool, you can take visual notes on the elements on the screen. Different types of pens and colours to highlight key points of a text, write notes on the screen, video or image. You can also save or delete the notes with a simple touch.

The Draw-on feature is enabled by clicking on the button on the content tool bar.

To modify the type of brush or colour, click on the button on the content tool bar.

From this pop-up you can modify:

  • Colour: sets the line colour.
  • Pencil: the line colour will be full and covering.
  • Highlighter: the line colour will be semi-transparent.
  • Eraser: lets you to delete parts of what was previously drawn.
  • Line size: sets the line width for the three types of brushes.

The line will also be saved automatically for later sessions.

Click on the icon on the content tool bar to delete everything that has been drawn.

docs.title: Info Points
docs.text: Add sensitive information points and pop-ups to any media content (images, pdf, documents). View descriptions, photos and video to create insights or wayfinding systems.

docs.title: Show and options
docs.text:
The image will be shown on the left with the location of information points above it .

After having selected a POI (information point), hold down CTRL and drag it to change its position within the image.

To the right you can:

  • Add or delete information points.
  • Modify the icon of the selected information point.
  • Modify the position again of the information point icon.
  • Title the title that is given to the window when the information point is selected.
  • Description a description is displayed inside the information point window when opened.
  • _Videos and/or Images_you can associate videos and images with the information point.
  • Open at the centre the information point is opened at the centre of the screen and not next to the information point.
  • Bottom bar enables or disables the bottom bar when a video is played.

You can also scroll through the videos and images associated with the information point using the left arrow and right arrow key commands.

If you want to open more than one information point at the same time, you must enable Multiple info point opening: in the archive settings . See Setttings

docs.title: Synchronisation
docs.text: Touchviewer can be managed both locally and remotely. It has been designed to distribute contents on an interactive network of stations installed in different locations. All Touchviewer clients can be configured to send or receive updates manually or in a scheduled manner. The entire architecture is based on an extremely powerful synchronisation system that ensures speed and reliability in all updating tasks with and to the remote server.

docs.title: Publish configuration
docs.text:
From here you can choose the destination for publishing contents. The destination can be a PC folder or a mapped network folder, a Dropbox service storage space.

Excluding thumbnails (recommended for archives with a lot of content) speeds up the publishing process. The thumbnails will be recreated upon synchronisation with the device downloading the updates.

If you choose DROPBOX cloud service, you will need to enter all the data of the account for authentication and the name of the folder found on Dropbox.

docs.title: Update configuration
docs.text:
Define the source from where you want to download updates. The source can be a PC folder, a network folder or a Dropbox.

Caution updates will be downloaded to the archive that is currently open.

Once you have selected the source from where you wish to download updates, you can set the synchronisation method:

  • Update contents upon software start-up Every time you start Touchviewer, the procedure performs a check of available updates and downloads any new content or any content that has been edited in the source folder. TickAsk for confirmation before updatingto receive notification asking if you want to update the archive. If you answer no, the update will be requested at the next Touchviewer start-up.
  • Do not update automatically Requires manual updating activation via the Update button.

docs.title: Search
docs.text:
Enable search from general Touchviewer settings ( See Settings ) to search individual files within the archive.

The icon you can click to open the search field will be shown on the navigation bar.

Once you have searched for the file, the results will be shown and you can select the desired content to open it directly on the current page.

docs.title: Themes Overview
docs.text: Touchviewer includes a suite of tools designed to manage GUI customisation quickly and easily. Themes and pre-configured settings will help you create your personal interactive composition.

docs.title: Basic features
docs.text:
The theme manager function lets you add new graphic themes and save them for later use. You can do the following from all theme selection and management menus:

  • Edit the current theme
  • Add a new theme
  • Delete the current theme

docs.title: Theme selection
docs.text: You can choose a theme among those saved.

docs.title: New theme
docs.text: Click on the + icon to create a new theme starting from the default settings.

docs.title: Duplicate theme
docs.text: Click on _Duplicate_to create a new theme starting from the settings of the currently selected theme.

docs.title: Elements theme
docs.text:
The element theme allows you to customise the graphic appearance of buttons (folders) for software navigation. You can manage the following options:

  • Form
  • Image
  • Image and text
  • Text only

Each of these displays can be configured graphically by setting the following parameters:

docs.title: FORM element template
docs.text: A form, which can be composed of a Title, a Description and an Image is displayed.

docs.title: Outer margin colour
docs.text: Sets the form container margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness
docs.text: Sets the form container margin thickness.

docs.title: Background colour
docs.text: Sets the form background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the form should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low
  • Medium
  • High

docs.title: Control colour
docs.text: Sets the colour of the margin surrounding the image and the margin separating the Title and Image or Description.

docs.title: Title Font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Title.

docs.title: Description font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Description.

docs.title: IMAGE element template
docs.text: The image loaded for each folder is used.

docs.title: IMAGE AND TEXT element template
docs.text: The image loaded is used and an overlay with the title and description are shown at the bottom.

docs.title: Text background colour
docs.text: Sets the background colour of the overlay on which text will appear.

docs.title: Title Font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Title.

docs.title: Description font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Description.

docs.title: TEXT ONLY element template
docs.text: The Title and Description are shown without any container.

docs.title: Title Font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Title.

docs.title: Description font
docs.text: Sets the font of the Description.

docs.title: Modules Theme
docs.text:
Modules theme customisation can be accessed from the "settings" screen. Customisation involves the graphic appearance of:

  • Favourites pop-ups
  • Search pop-up
  • Loading pop-up
  • Comments pop-up

To edit the Comments pop-up, select the Comment theme and edit it.

docs.title: Outer margin colour
docs.text: Sets the Pop-up container margin colour.

docs.title: Margin thickness
docs.text: Sets the Pop-up container margin thickness.

docs.title: Background colour
docs.text: Sets the Pop-up background colour.

docs.title: Shade
docs.text:
Sets the shade that the Pop-up should have. You can choose from:

  • None
  • Low
  • Medium
  • High

docs.title: Button/control colour
docs.text: Sets the colour that any buttons/controls inside the Pop-up should have.

docs.title: Button font
docs.text: Sets the font inside buttons.

docs.title: Content font

docs.title: Navigation bar theme
docs.text: The navigation bar can also be customised for each individual section, setting the following options:

Sets the type of bar in 2 different modes:

docs.title: Folder font [Only in complete bar mode]

docs.title: Button type [Only in button function only mode]

docs.title: Preview Bar Theme

Sets the position of the bar on he screen. You can choose from:

docs.title: Preview size

docs.title: Preview margin

docs.title: In the foreground

docs.title: Margin thickness

docs.title: Corner rounding

docs.title: Bar background colour

docs.title: Shade

Sets the shade that the preview bar should have. You can choose from:

Shows the label over each thumbnail. You can choose from:

docs.title: Margin thickness

docs.title: Margin thickness

docs.title: Element background colour

docs.title: Toolbars

Lets you manage bar visibility:
